thread.title: Clinton calls on Trump to speak out against anti-Semitism
thread.title_full: Clinton calls on Trump to speak out against anti-Semitism | Washington Examiner

author: Kyle Feldscher
title: Clinton calls on Trump to speak out against anti-Semitism
text:
Hillary Clinton called on President Trump to condemn threats against Jewish community centers and the vandalism at an historic Jewish cemetery in St. Louis Tuesday morning.
"JCC threats, cemetery desecration & online attacks are so troubling & they need to be stopped. Everyone must speak out, starting w/ @POTUS," Clinton tweeted Tuesday.
JCC threats, cemetery desecration & online attacks are so troubling & they need to be stopped. Everyone must speak out, starting w/ @POTUS .â€” Hillary Clinton (@HillaryClinton) February 21, 2017 
Democrats have been calling on Trump to speak out more directly against anti-Semitic threats and actions in recent days. The White House issued a statement during the weekend, but Trump himself brushed off multiple comments about anti-Semitism during press conferences last week.

  Washington Examiner News Alerts.   alert soon! The White House, through a spokesperson, said Trump has made it very clear he condemns such actions.
